707068f-b.text:
Tillary Street, west from Jay Street, showing more of the south side of the street. The 6-story white building is the Brooklyn Edison Company Building, at Pearl Street, and beyond that, across the "El," is the corner of the United States Post Office. In the left background is the Montague-Court Building.

View 1: June 2, 1931
View 2: September 9, 1939

P.L. Sperr.

View 2 shows the S.E. corner of Tillary and Jay Streets, Tillary being on the left, extending to Lawrence Street; Jay Street is on the right. The cleared area in the same as that seen on the right in view 1, where the buildings were razed.
707068f-b.folder: Tillary St. & Jay St., Brooklyn, NY

707068f-a.folder: Tillary St. & Jay St., Brooklyn, NY

707069f-a.text:
Tillary Street, east across Jay Street. One the left is McLaughlin Park.

P.L. Sperr.

September 9, 1939
